person.persName: James Harlan Jr (Franklin County/Mercer County Lawyer/Politician)

body.p: Native of Kentucky. Son of the U.S. Congressman and Whig politician James Harlan Sr. James Harlan Junior's brother, John M. Harlan, served as a justice of the United States Supreme Court from 1877 to 1911.

James Harlan Jr. worked as a lawyer. He supported the Constitutional Union Party and John Bell in the Presidential Election of 1860, speaking publicly for the party. He went on to become a representative of Franklin County in the Kentucky General Assembly in 1865-1866.
